title: Administration of Temporary Shelters for providing Protection to Female Victims of Violence
decision_details: - With a view to providing temporary care and protection to female victims of gender based violence and children, the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs maintains ten (10) shelters viz. one each in Gampaha, Ratnapura, Monaragala, Colombo, Matara, Batticaloa, Mullaitivu and Jaffna Districts and two (02) shelters in Anuradhapura District, and it has been planned to start a temporary shelter in Nuwara‑Eliya District from January 2025. The administration and maintenance cost of some shelters is directly borne by the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs, while the relevant cost of some shelters is borne by women-welfare based Organizations. Protection to 2,852 female victims has been provided from 2020 up to the second quarter of the year 2024 and a cost of Rs.60.35 million has been borne for the same. However, the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs has received only an allocation of Rs.37.69 million for the purpose during the said period and bills amounting to Rs.22 million remain to be settled. Accordingly, taking into consideration to the proposal made by the Minister of Women and Child Affairs, Cabinet approval was granted to allocate Rs.25 million for the year 2025 and for the allocation of the necessary provisions for the ensuing years through the Annual Budgetary Estimates.
